# subdata(with:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a new data object containing the data object’s bytes that fall within the limits specified by a given range.

## Declaration

```swift
func subdata(with range: NSRange) -> Data
```

## Parameters

- **range**: The range in the receiver from which to get the data. If this range is not within the data object’s range of bytes, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSExceptionName/rangeException] is raised.

## Return Value

A data object containing the receiver’s bytes that fall within the limits specified by `range`.

## Discussion

A sample using this method can be found in [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/BinaryData/Tasks/WorkingBinaryData.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/20000717].

## Finding Data

- **range(of:options:in:)**: Finds and returns the range of the first occurrence of the given data, within the given range, subject to given options.
- **NSData.SearchOptions**: Options for method used to search data objects.
